The ultimate goal is timely diagnosis to guide definitive treatment, typically surgery with possible adjuvant therapy depending on staging. STEP 5 - MONITORING & FOLLOW-UP STRATEGY: Prioritize prompt colonoscopy within days to weeks, with close follow-up on symptoms, nutritional status, and readiness for definitive therapy. Watch for worsening symptoms such as severe bleeding, obstruction, or perforation. STEP 6 - PATIENT COMMUNICATION STRATEGY: Given her anxiety, communicate clearly, empathetically, and with reassurance regarding the diagnostic process and next steps. Address fears, explain the purpose of procedures, and involve her in decision-making to enhance compliance. STEP 7 - COORDINATION & REFERRALS: Immediate referral to a gastroenterologist for colonoscopy, surgical oncology for definitive treatment planning, and psychological support services are essential. Coordination with multidisciplinary teams will optimize care.
